intro: Anisotes tanensis, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has a robust, upright stem with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are typically borne in clusters at the ends of the stems, and they have a unique, lantern-like appearance. Anisotes tanensis is a member of the Araceae family, known for its showy inflorescences and aquatic or semi-aquatic growth habits in its native habitat.
